description: Learned borrowing from Ancient Greek ἀγκύλος (ankúlos) +‎ γλῶσσᾰ (glôssa) +‎ -ῐ́ᾱ (-íā); surface analysis, ankylo- +‎ -glossia.

entries.meaning: (medicine) A congenital oral anomaly in which the lingual frenulum is unusually short and thick, decreasing mobility of the tongue and affecting eating, speech, etc.
